greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer partitions y of n such that exactly one permutation of y is a Lyndon word.
example: The a(6) = 7 partitions are (6), (51), (42), (411), (3111), (2211), (21111). This list does not include (321) because there are two possible permutations that are Lyndon words, namely (123) and (132). The list does not include (33), (222), or (111111) because no permutation of these is a Lyndon word.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jan 30 2018
